row.format: Transgender people are protected from discrimination in employment, housing, public accommodations (providers of goods and/or services, such as restaurants, medical offices, hospitals, theaters, etc.) and bias-related harassment.

It is illegal to be fired because of your pregnancy. Pregnant women are protected from discrimination under the NYC Human Rights Law. Your Employer may be obligated to grant you a reasonable accommodation during the course of your pregnancy.

Employers cannot treat you differently based on your immigration status or whether or not you are a U.S. citizen. Employers cannot: have "citizen-only" hiring policies, unless required by law; reject your documents because you look or sound "foreign."
Sexual Harassment is a form of gender discrimination in violation of the New York City Human Rights Law.
The NYC Human Rights Law Protects Victims of domestic Violence from employment discrimination.
